net.sf.clickclick.control
Class BooleanSelect

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.click.control.AbstractControl
      org.apache.click.control.Field
          org.apache.click.control.Select
              net.sf.clickclick.control.BooleanSelect
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, org.apache.click.Control
public class BooleanSelect
extends org.apache.click.control.Select

Provides a Select control that can be used as either a simple two-option select (TRUE / FALSE) or as a tristate select (UNSET / TRUE / FALSE).

BooleanSelect

Use

Tristate is handy when you want to confirm that the user made a concious descision and not just accepted the default value.

Please note that tristate can best be used in combination with required and that the required property is useless when used in combination with the two-state (as there will always be an option selected).

The default value when creating a BooleanSelect field is: Required == Tristate.

Changing one of these properties after creation will not influence the other.

Values

In holding with IntegerField, DateField and others the BooleanSelect field provides getBoolean() and setBoolean() methods.

The setValue() and setObjectValue() only allow Boolean objects or Strings(containing "true" or "false").

null or empty strings are allowed in all these method and means: value not set (unset). In keeping with the other Fields, null values are stored and returned as "" (empty string). The getValueObject() method does not return an empty string but null instead.

Makeup

The labels used for the true and false options can be customized in two ways: manually or with one of the built-in notations

Use the setOptionLabels() convenience methods or the individual properties to manually set.

Or use the setNotation() method to use one of the built-in notations.

Following notations are provided and backed by the resource-bundle (i18n).

  • TRUE / FALSE -- default
  • YES / NO
  • ON / OFF
  • ACTIVE / INACTIVE
  • OPEN / CLOSED

Remark: Options are created in control.onInit() all makeup needs to be done in page.onInit() or earlier; changes made in onRender(), onPost() or action listeners, will not be reflected in the final result.

Author:
Christopher Highway
See Also:
Select, Serialized Form

The unset option label value will default to "".

getNotation

public java.lang.String getNotation()
Returns the notation used for the BooleanSelect.

Returns:
the notation for the BooleanSelect

setNotation

public void setNotation(java.lang.String notation)
Change the option labels to one of the built-in notations.

The following notations are provided which is also available through the resource-bundle for i18n support.

  • TRUEFALSE (true/false}
  • YESNO (yes/no)
  • ONOFF (on/off)
  • ACTIVEINACTIVE (active/inactive)
  • OPENCLOSED (open/closed)
  • CUSTOM (this option is automatically set when you provide custom labels with: setOptionLabels())
The prefered way of setting the notation is by using the static properties of this class:

setNotation(BooleanSelect.YESNO);

Parameters:
notation - the notation to set the field's labels to

isTristate

public boolean isTristate()
Return true if the tristate option is enabled, false otherwise.

Returns:
true if the tristate option is enabled, false otherwise.

setTristate

public void setTristate(boolean tristate)
Set the tristate option of the field. If tristate is set to true this indicates that the select field will contain three options, true, false and unset. Otherwise the select will only contain two options, true and false.

Parameters:
tristate - false = 2 options, true = 3 options

custom value or message from language bundle according to the chosen notation
